definition: scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: It was exterminated root and branch.
Some of the branches must be cut off in order for the tree to grow.
sentences.chinese: 必须剪除一些枝干，让整棵树更好地生长。

sentences.english: Pruning, by removing part of the top, alters this ratio.
sentences.chinese: 修剪通过剪除部分树冠而改变根冠比。

sentences.english: That happy trail needs a prune.
sentences.chinese: 那条欢乐的小尾巴需要剪除。

sentences.english: Cut ye not off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites
sentences.chinese: 你们不可将哥辖人的支派从利未人中剪除。

sentences.english: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things
sentences.chinese: 凡油滑的嘴唇，和夸大的舌头，耶和华必要剪除。

sentences.english: 3May the Lord cut off all flattering lips and every boastful tongue
sentences.chinese: 凡油滑的嘴唇，和夸大的舌头，耶和华必要剪除。

sentences.english: Try to remove as little healthy green wood and green leaves as possible.
sentences.chinese: 合理地剪除不健康的绿枝和绿叶。

sentences.english: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you.
sentences.chinese: 你无论往哪里去，我常与你同在，剪除你的一切仇敌。

sentences.english: Neither shouldest thou have stood in the crossway, to cut off those of his that did escape;
sentences.chinese: 你不当站在岔路口，剪除他们中间逃脱的。

sentences.english: Those who are not circumcised are in fact to be cut off from the covenant community.
sentences.chinese: 未受割礼的人，事实上是从圣约团体被剪除的人。

sentences.english: Everyone who does any of these detestable things-such persons must be cut off from their people.
sentences.chinese: 无论什么人，行了其中可憎的一件事，必从民中剪除。

definition: to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
